name: unionism
content:
unionism noun [U]
(POLITICS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also Unionism) support for the policy that the countries of the UK should remain united, especially that Northern Ireland should remain part of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland: He saw himself as the unrivalled defender of unionism. the progressive wing of Ulster Unionism This was a period that marked the decline of Scottish unionism and a rise in Scottish nationalism.
(also Unionism) at the time of the American Civil War, support for the Union (= the states that did not separate from the United States): See the documents listed below for examples of antislavery unionism in the border states. He came from East Tennessee, that bastion of Unionism from the days of Andrew Johnson.
(also Unionism) the general political principle that a country or state should remain united with others in a larger union: She was one of the leading figures of Catalan unionism. Spanish unionism opposed independence for the Basque and Catalan regions.
More examplesFewer examplesIrish nationalism’s premise is that the link to Britain is not permanent, whereas unionism contends that it will endure.

(WORK)
